ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] More Thoughts and Questions . . .
ygData.msgSnippet: Salutations Suzanne! Yes, Surefall Glade might be nice. We have been invited to another wedding that is going to take place there so we are planning to come
ygData.messageBody:
Salutations Suzanne!

Yes, Surefall Glade might be nice. We have been
invited to another wedding that is going to take place
there so we are planning to come and see how
everything works out.
Right now I think everyone on my friend list is up to
lvl 13 or higher so I think most of the guests should
not have a major problem getting there if they want to
come. We can offer transportation from the druids (I
seem to have a fairly high number of druid friends for
some reason, well 3 or 4 anyway including my
intended).

I know what you mean about being the ranger that was
lost, I generally have no idea where I am, but I guess
I must be a bit more timid in my exploring then you
were. In fact, it's kind of a running joke with us
now.

A tell between us might go something like this: Me,
"Dear heart, how do I get to "place x"?"
Him, "Where are you now hun?"
Me "I don't really know, but I think I'm in the "so
and so" zone."
Him, "Ok dear no problem, just go east."
Me, "Which way is east?"
Him, (after delivering some kind of arcane analysis of
the weather and cloud patterns or Norrath) "and that
should take you right there."
Me, "???"
Him, "Or, you could just try sense heading."
Me, "You know my sense heading is broken."
Him, "No, it's not broken dear, just keep trying it."
Me, "I'm telling you this thing is broken, even when
it gives me a direction I'm not sure if I can trust
it."
Him, (seeming more frustrated now for some reason)
"Just keep trying, it's not broken."
Me, (with an appropriate silance and a sigh) "OK."
Him, "Do you want me to come help you?"
Me, "No, I'm fine, just lost that's all, you know I'm
always lost, kind of funny really, I'm the ranger who
has no sense of direction."
Him, "Yes, funny, ha ha, Now, just keep pushing sense
heading."
Me, "OK, but I'm telling you it's broken."
Him, "It's not broken!"

And so on it goes . . .

I have now explored most of Feydwar, and I'm working
on Antonica (sp) now, but it's a very slow process
with me. Got killed twice in North Karana last night
by Griffons . . . ack, that was frustrating and not
good for the exp lvl but did manage to make lvl 21
never the less.

Anyway, it's fun and I'm learning.
:o)

Best Regards till next time,
Hugs,
:o)
Brangvyne
Lvl 21.5 Wood Elf Ranger of Tunare
:o)

--- "Suzanne J. Johnson" <katannah@...> wrote:
> Yes, yes--Surefall Glade. We did it inside the main
> temple tree, with some help from the DM (the cleric
> there kept attacking him so he had to keep killing
> him, which was really funny and sort of par for our
> relationship). If it's going to be small, that's a
> very lovely location for it.
>
> I was the ranger that was lost, so I ended up
> aaaaaaaaaaaall over the place. I died a lot between
> first and fifth. ;-) We used to love just roaming
> around and never had a teleport until we'd
> thoroughly explored two of the continents (the main
> human one and Feydwer). But really, the people we
> ran into that way were some of our favorites for
> years... and some of our guildmates!
> S.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Brangvyne Accampo
> To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Friday, December 06, 2002 7:44 PM
> Subject: Re: [EQ_women] More Thoughts and
> Questions . . .
>
>
> Salutations Suzanne!
>
> Thanks for the note. Do you mean Surefall Glade?
> If so
> that's where I'm at right now in the game more or
> less. I'm soulbound there anyway.
> :o)
>
> That could be an idea though, it is kind of a neat
> place. I'm not sure how many people will even come
> to
> something like this. I expect it to be small. I'm
> fairly new to the game and don't know lots of
> people
> yet. He has played for much longer but tends to be
> a
> loner and solo a lot, at least before he ran into
> me.
>
> It might be an idea though. Funny I was right
> there
> and didn't even think of it. Of course, there are
> so
> many places I haven't been yet.
>
> As for guilds I sort of have this feeling that its
> a
> bit tacky to go around asking. On the other hand I
> really want to try that part of the game out.
> Maybe I don't have enough escapades.
> :o)
>
> Hugs,
> :o)
> Brangvyne
>
> --- "Suzanne J. Johnson" <katannah@...>
> wrote:
> > There's a ranger haven on the mainland outside
> of
> > Qeynos, IIRC. That's where I got married. The
> name
> > escapes me (haven't played in a long while) but
> > someone on the list should know of which I
> speak.
> > It's very nice. If you have any concerns about
> > guests' safety, ask some of your 'wedding party'
> to
> > be 'ushers', ie., escort your guests from
> Qeynos.
> > Or have a wizard 'port 'em in.
> >
> > My fiance and I were both rangers. We were very
> > effective at taunting; once one'd take too much
> > damage, the other would start taunting madly.
> > 'Course, the roles may have changed in the past
> > year...
> >
> > Guilds, eh... they're nice if you've joined one
> > because you regularly adventure with many of its
> > members, but I never personally advertised for a
> > guild. I tended to let my escapades take me
> where
> > they would (as an elven ranger when Povar was
> first
> > new, there was A LOT of escapade) and ran into
> my
> > guild brethren when hunting. When I began
> looking
> > for them when I signed on, I knew I was finding
> a
> > "home". Just my two coppers'.
> >
> > Best regards,
> >
> > Aelwesara Cuthalion, Ranger of Tunare
> > Ertho Cuthalion!
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Brangvyne
> > To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
> > Sent: Friday, December 06, 2002 1:19 PM
> > Subject: [EQ_women] More Thoughts and
> Questions .
> > . .
> >
> >
> > Salutations All!
> >
> > I have not posted for a while, and I know
> everyone
> > was probably
> > relaxing a little and here I am again.
> > :o)
> >
> > EQ has been progressing prettry good for me I
> > think. I've made a
> > couple of good friends who are more
> experienced
> > then me and don't
> > seem to mind giving advice or helping out so
> > that's very nice.
> >
> > I've also been trying to learn more about my
> role
> > as a Ranger in
> > Norrath. I just found out last week what a
> handy
> > thing taunt can be
> > when trying to keep a mob off your healer? OK,
> I'm
> > slow but I'm
> > getting there I think. And I've gotten duel
> wield
> > and double attack
> > now so that's interesting to play with.
> >
> > Last night a Druid friend and I went to Paudal
> > Cavern for my first
> > trip there. I would have died twice during the
> > first fight we had I
> > think if they had not been there to keep me
> from
> > deaths door. That
> > was a tough mob and red all the way for me at
> lvl
> > 19 (20 now).
> >
> > Anyway, enough ramblin, so it's question time:
> >
> > 1.) I have been asked to get married and have
> said
> > yes. :o) Any good
> > suggestions on locations that would be nice
> but
> > not to hard for
> > guests to get to? He has a place in mind, I
> forget
> > the name, but it
> > sounds like it might be hard for lower level
> > characters to even
> > reach. I have not traveled over much of
> Norrath
> > still so I'm not
> > sure. Anyway, if anyone has ideas I'd love to
> hear
> > them.
> > Also, when things are set, which may be a
> while
> > I'll post a note here
> > letting everyone know. You are all invited, of
> > course, feel free to
> > come if you have a character on the Xegony
> server,
> > of if you want
> > just create a quick one at the proper time and
> > come anyway. I'd love
> > to meet anyone who might do me the honor of
> > coming.
> >
> > 2.) Can anyone give me advice on how to find a
> > guild that might be
> > interested in letting a Ranger in the low 20's
> > join? Would it be ok
> > to just kind of start asking around? Is there
> a
> > way to tell a better
> > guild from one not as good?
> >
> > Anyway, I hope everyone had a nice
> Thanksgiving.
> >
> > Hugs
> > :o)
> > Bran
> > lvl 20 Wood Elf Ranger
> >
> >
> >

> Yahoo!
> > Terms of Service.
> >
> >
